legs.text: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your body by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, then return to the starting position.
Stand with your feet together, then step forward with one leg and lower your body until both knees are bent at a 90-degree angle. Return to the starting position and switch legs.
Sit on the leg press machine and push the weight up, extending your legs. Slowly return to the starting position.
Stand with your feet flat on the ground and raise your heels, then lower them back down.
Lie face down on the machine and curl your legs up towards your glutes, then slowly lower them back down.

back.text: Hang from a bar with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Pull yourself up until your chin is above the bar, then lower yourself back down.
Hold a dumbbell in each hand, hinge at the hips, and row the weights up towards your chest, then lower them back down.
Sit at a lat pulldown machine, grip the bar wider than shoulder-width, and pull it down to your chest, then release it slowly.
Stand with your feet hip-width apart, grip a barbell, push your hips back, and lift the barbell up, then lower it back down.
Hold a barbell, bend at the hips, and row the barbell up towards your chest, then lower it back down.

arms.text: Hold dumbbells in each hand, curl them up towards your shoulders, then lower them back down.
Sit on a bench, place your hands next to your hips, and lift your body off the bench. Lower yourself down by bending your elbows, then push back up.
Hold dumbbells in each hand with your palms facing inwards. Curl them up towards your shoulders, then lower them back down.
Stand at a cable machine with a straight bar attachment, push the bar down, then release it slowly.
Sit on a bench with your forearms resting on your thighs, hold a dumbbell in each hand, and curl your wrists up and down.

core.text: Lie face down with your forearms on the ground. Lift your body off the ground, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels.
Sit on the ground, lean back slightly, lift your feet off the ground, and twist your torso to the left and right, touching the ground on each side.
Lie flat on your back, lift your legs up towards the ceiling, then lower them back down without letting them touch the ground.
Lie on your back, lift your legs, and perform a bicycle pedaling motion while bringing your opposite elbow to your knee.
Start in a plank position, bring one knee towards your chest, then switch legs in a running motion.
